intro: Hieracium leucopithodes, commonly known as the white-topped hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Hieracium leucopithodes is known for its ability to spread vegetatively through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain habitats.
